# 2024 Indiana Republican presidential primary

Trump
| image1 = Official Presidential Portrait of President Donald J. Trump (2025).jpg
| candidate1 = Donald Trump
| color1 = 283681
| home_state1 = Florida
| popular_vote1 = 464,399
| percentage1 = 78.3%
| delegate_count1 = 58
| image2 = Nikki Haley (53299447738) (cropped).jpg
| candidate2 = Nikki Haley  (withdrawn)
| color2 = FE6100
| home_state2 = South Carolina
| popular_vote2 = 128,812
| percentage2 = 21.7%
| delegate_count2 = 0
}}
The 2024 Indiana Republican presidential primary was held on May 7, 2024, as part of the Republican Party primaries for the 2024 presidential election. 58 delegates to the 2024 Republican National Convention will be allocated on a winner-take-all basis.
Endorsements
}}
State representatives
* Bob Heaton, district 46 (2010–present)
* Chris Jeter, district 88 (2020–present)
* Shane Lindauer, district 63 (2017–present)
Notable individual
* Karen McDougal, model and alleged former mistress of Donald Trump
}}
* Greg Pence, IN-06 (2019–present) (candidate's brother)
Governor
*Eric Holcomb (2017–2025)
State representative
*Todd Huston, district 37 (2012–present); speaker (2020–present)
U.S. representatives
* Jim Banks, IN-03 (2017–present)
* John Hostettler, IN-08 (1995–2007)
* Erin Houchin, IN-09 (2023–present)
* Marlin Stutzman, IN-03 (2010–2017)
*Rudy Yakym, IN-02 (2022–present)
State executive officials
*Diego Morales, Secretary of State of Indiana (2023–present)
*Todd Rokita, Indiana Attorney General (2021–present) and U.S. Representative of IN-04 (2011–2019)
U.S. vice president
* Mike Pence (2017–2021), Governor of Indiana (2013–2017), Representative from Indiana (2001–2013), and withdrawn candidate in 2024
}}
